statements: UPDATE firewall_rules SET rule_name = 'Allow SSH', source_ip = '192.168.1.100', destination_ip = '10.0.0.1', port = 22, protocol = 'TCP' WHERE rule_id = 1;
UPDATE firewall_rules SET source_ip = '10.0.0.2', destination_ip = '192.168.1.200', protocol = 'UDP', rule_name = 'Allow DNS', port = 53 WHERE rule_id = 2;
UPDATE firewall_rules SET port = 8080, protocol = 'TCP' WHERE rule_id = 1;
UPDATE firewall_rules SET source_ip = '192.168.1.100', destination_ip = '10.10.10.10', protocol = 'UDP' WHERE rule_name = 'Allow-SSH-Inbound';
UPDATE firewall_rules SET rule_port = 8080, rule_protocol = 'TCP' WHERE rule_id = 1;
UPDATE network_zones SET zone_description = 'Updated zone description', zone_subnet = '192.168.0.0/24' WHERE zone_id = 2;
UPDATE firewall_rules SET rule_name='New Rule 1', rule_description='Update description 1', rule_protocol='UDP', rule_port=8080 WHERE rule_id=1;
UPDATE network_zones SET zone_description='Updated zone description', zone_name='New Zone', zone_subnet='10.0.0.0/24' WHERE zone_id=2;
UPDATE firewall_config SET rule_name = 'Allow SSH', rule_description = 'Allow SSH connections from all IP addresses', rule_type = 'INBOUND', rule_enabled = true WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE firewall_config SET rule_enabled = false, rule_name = 'Block FTP', rule_description = 'Block FTP connections from specific IP addresses', rule_type = 'OUTBOUND' WHERE rule_name = 'Block FTP';
UPDATE firewall_config SET rule_name='Block IP', rule_description='Deny access from a specific IP address', rule_type='IP Block', rule_enabled=1 WHERE id=1;
UPDATE firewall_config SET rule_type='Port Block', rule_name='Block Port 80', rule_description='Deny access to port 80', rule_enabled=0 WHERE id=2;
UPDATE firewall_rules_config SET rule_description = 'Updated rule description' WHERE rule_id = 1;
UPDATE network_settings SET subnet_mask = '255.255.252.0', network_address = '192.168.1.0' WHERE setting_id = 3;
UPDATE firewall_rules_config SET rule_name = 'Updated Rule Name', rule_description = 'Updated Description' WHERE rule_id = 1;
UPDATE network_settings SET subnet_mask = '255.255.255.0', network_name = 'Updated Network Name' WHERE setting_id = 2;
UPDATE firewall_settings SET rule_name = 'New Rule 1', allow_traffic = true WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE rule_conditions SET condition_value = '500' WHERE condition_name = 'Threshold' AND rule_id = 2;
UPDATE firewall_settings SET allow_traffic = TRUE WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE rule_conditions SET condition_value = 'high' WHERE id = 5 AND rule_id = 2;
